name: typescript-npm-starter
description: A quick start for NPM projects with Typescript sources.

scripts.?setup: echo Setup package.json for your upcoming package.
scripts.?build: echo Compile typescript sources to JS files and typescript definitions.
scripts.?test: echo Run unit tests on compiled files.
scripts.?doc:generate: echo Generate HTML documentation based on typescript sources. Will be deployed to docs/ folder. This folder is not pushed to git or npm.
scripts.?doc:publish: echo Will publish generated HTML documentation to GitHub pages, using credentials from current git repo. Will only work if you are working with GitHub. Documentation will be visible online here : https://{organisation-name}.github.io/{repo-name}/
scripts.?doc: echo Will generate and publish documentation to GitHub pages
scripts.doc: npm run doc:generate && npm run doc:publish
scripts.?clean: echo Remove all generated files like compiled JS files, typescript definitions and documentation.
scripts.?reinstall: echo Remove and re-install all node modules.
scripts.?increment: echo Increment package.json version through CLI.
scripts.?pre-commit: echo Before commiting to Git, we clean, build and test everything. Package.json version is incremented through CLI.
scripts.pre-commit: npm run clean && npm run build && npm run test && npm run increment
scripts.?pre-push: echo Before pushing an update to Git, we generate and publish docs to gh-pages, then we publish to NPM.

author: Alexis Bouhet
